newsitem.title: FRANCE: Main lines of French private pension fund bill.
newsitem.headline: Main lines of French private pension fund bill.

text.p: Following ore the main lines of the French bill, adopted in the National Assembly on Friday, on the introduction of private pension funds in France.
- Funds will be managed by banks, insurers, mutual groups and provident societies
- Funds will be monitored by a supervisory committee which meets twice a year
- Contributions are voluntary, can come from employees and employers and can be suspended, then restarted without penalty
- Employee can decline to contribute to fund set up on the employer's initiative or choose an external fund if the employer refuses or is unable to create one
- Employee can keep and transfer pension rights in case where work contract is terminated
- Employee can arrange for transfer of annuity payments to surviving partner, children who are minors or infirm in case of death
- Employee contributions included in calculation of employee social contributions from salary
- Employee contributions suject to income tax write-off the tune of five percent of annual gross salary or 20 percent of the Social Security regime ceiling (currently 13,540 francs a month)
- Employer contributions cannot exceed four times those of employee
- Employer contributions deductible for purposes of payroll social contributions to the tune of 4,000 francs a year plus two percent of annual gross salary
- Contributors can opt for lump-sum payment to tune of 20 percent of capital with ceiling of 100,000 francs with special provisions in case of invalidity or similar causes
- Lump-sum or annuities subject to income tax and CSG and CRDS levies
- Ceiling of 65 percent on amount of funds that can be invested in bonds
- Up to 10 percent of funds can be invested in non-quoted companies
